@u_loose wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:13, topic:522679”][quote author=u loose link=topic=641175.msg4320415#msg4320415 date=1372149871]
Would you be able to show me your command for yell?
[/quote]
My server doesn’t have any commands yet (aside from basic testing ones).
But it would be like:

if(playerCommand.equalsIgnoreCase("yell")){
     String title = "";
     switch(c.playerRights){
          case 0:
               title = "[Player]";
          break;
     }
    //For loop here
     c.sendMessage(title + message);
}

Something like that.[/quote]

do you mind if i try that out dude?

[quote=“u loose, post:10, topic:522679”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=641175.msg4320389#msg4320389 date=1372144418]
It’s bad practice to make duplicate commands like that though.
[/quote]

what would you recommend?[/quote]
Using one command at playerRights 0,
and have a switch statement in the command for the title of each playerRights, and the the message would be sent with the title, and then their message.

item.title: ::yell (solved)
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

That’s because you have your command broken into 4 commands, or how ever many.
Each having something like:
&& c.playerRights >= 4
So if a player (or owner) has greater rights then what the command requires. It does the command,
So when an owner does the command, it does it 4+ times, because they have greater rights than 1, 2, 3, and possibly 4.

Read full topic

item.description:

}else if (c.playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(""+ Config.OWNER +"")) { c2.sendMessage("<col=16777215><shad=14024897><img=3> [Owner]</col></shad> <img=3> " + Misc.optimizeText(c.playerName) +"</col></shad>:<col=16777215><shad=14024897> " + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)) +"");[/quote]

it also happens when my player is admin he gets
[server support]
[mod]
[admin]

what i want to change is when admins do ::yell hi only the [admin]:hi comes up not.
[server support]a:hi
[mod]a:hi
[admin]a:hi
which is what currently is happening.

item.title: ::yell (solved)
item.dc:creator: @u_loose u loose
item.description:
@u_loose wrote:

when my owner account does ::yell it comes up with
[sever support]
[mod]
[admin]
[owner]

all saying the same thing.

[code]if(c.playerRights >= 4) {

		if (playerCommand.startsWith("yell") && c.playerRights >= 4) {
			for (int j = 0; j < Server.playerHandler.players.length; j++) {
				if (Server.playerHandler.players[j] != null) {
					Client c2 = (Client)Server.playerHandler.players[j];
					c2.sendMessage("[@red@Owner@bla@]" + c.playerName + ": @red@" + Misc.optimizeText(playerCommand.substring(5)));[/code]

thats my owners yell command.

Read full topic
